intro: Reseda dipetala, commonly known as the two-petaled reseda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, with two distinct petals that give it its common name. Reseda dipetala is often found in arid regions and is adapted to survive in low-nutrient soils.
